result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3:40 PM Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Cleveland A Shaw.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense states that the Defendant is here in a conference room and he is very ill. Based upon that, Defense requests to adjourn. State does not object to a short adjournment. 

Court will reset sentencing hearing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on November 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

3:02 PM Defendant Cleveland A Shaw in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Cleveland A Shaw. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane. 
There are no victims on this case. 

Atty Griffis requests to proceed to plea only today. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #1. Court conducts colloquy with the Defendant and finds them guilty of count #1. 

Court sets plea/sentencing hearing. 

State is requesting remand of the Defendant on this case. Defense objects, and requests that bond be continued. Court will decline request for remand, and will continue bond as set.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Hearing on April 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

08:21 AM Defendant Cleveland A Shaw in court, in custody, with attorney Justin G Griffis.   Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Officer Jason Krueger, of the City of Brookfield Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Sitzberger.
Cross examination by atty. Griffis.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
